intro: Vulvaria polysperma, commonly known as the common vulvaria, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. It has a basal rosette of leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The fruit is a dry, two-lobed schizocarp that releases two small, winged seeds when mature.
